ingredients:
1 lb chicken breast, diced
1 onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
2 cans (15 oz each) white beans, drained and rinsed
1 can (4 oz) chopped green chilies
2 cups chicken broth
1 cup heavy cream
1 tsp cumin
1 tsp oregano
Salt and pepper to taste
Optional toppings: shredded cheese, sour cream, chopped cilantro, sliced jalapenos
cooking_instructions:
In a large pot, cook diced chicken breast until no longer pink.
Add chopped onion and minced garlic, cook until onion is translucent.
Stir in white beans, chopped green chilies, chicken broth, heavy cream, cumin, and oregano.                                                                                                                  Simmer for 20-30 minutes, stirring occasionally.
Season with salt and pepper to taste.
Serve hot with optional toppings.

ingredients:
2-3 ripe bananas, mashed
1/3 cup melted butter
3/4 cup sugar
1 egg, beaten
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 tsp baking soda
Pinch of salt
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x5 inch loaf pan.
2. In a mixing bowl, combine mashed bananas, melted butter, sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla extract.
3. Mix in baking soda and salt.
4. Add flour and stir until just combined.
5. Pour batter into prepared loaf pan.
6. Bake for 60-65 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow to cool before slicing and serving.

ingredients:
1 lb ground beef
1 onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
3 cups chicken broth
2 cups diced potatoes
1 cup shredded carrots
1 cup diced celery
1 can (14.5 oz) diced tomatoes
2 cups milk
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
Salt and pepper to taste
Optional toppings: chopped green onions, cooked and crumbled bacon, shredded cheese
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large pot, brown ground beef over medium heat.
2. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, cook until onion is translucent.
3. Stir in chicken broth, diced potatoes, shredded carrots, diced celery, and diced tomatoes.
4. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until vegetables are tender, about 15-20 minutes.
5. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk and flour until smooth.
6. Gradually stir milk mixture into the soup, stirring constantly.
7. Continue to cook and stir until soup has thickened.
8. Stir in shredded cheddar cheese until melted.
9. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
10. Serve hot with optional toppings.

ingredients:
6 slices bread, cubed
1 lb bulk pork sausage, cooked and crumbled
2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
6 eggs
2 cups milk
1 tsp mustard powder
Salt and pepper to taste
Optional add-ins: diced bell peppers, sliced mushrooms, chopped onions
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. Place cubed bread in the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
3. Sprinkle cooked and crumbled sausage evenly over the bread.
4. Top with shredded cheddar cheese.
5. In a mixing bowl, whisk together eggs, milk, mustard powder, salt, and pepper.
6. Pour egg mixture evenly over the sausage and cheese.
7. If using optional add-ins, sprinkle them over the top.
8. Bake for 45-55 minutes, or until eggs are set and the top is golden brown.
9. Allow to cool slightly before slicing and serving.

recipe_name: Pumpkin Spice Cupcakes with Cream Cheese Frosting
ingredients:
For the cupcakes:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 tsp baking powder
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
1 tsp ground cinnamon
1/2 tsp ground ginger
1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
1/4 tsp ground cloves
1 cup pumpkin puree
1/2 cup vegetable oil
2 large eggs
1 cup granulated sugar
1/2 cup packed light brown sugar
For the cream cheese frosting:
8 oz cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
2 cups powdered sugar
1 tsp vanilla extract
cooking_instructions:
For the cupcakes:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.
2. In a medium bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon, ginger, nutmeg, and cloves.
3. In a separate large bowl, whisk together pumpkin puree, vegetable oil, eggs, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until smooth.
4. Gradually whisk dry ingredients into wet ingredients until just combined.
5. Divide batter evenly among cupcake liners, filling each about 2/3 full.
6. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
7. Allow cupcakes to cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
For the cream cheese frosting:
1. In a mixing bowl, beat together softened cream cheese and butter until smooth and creamy.
2. Gradually add powdered sugar and vanilla extract, beating until smooth and fluffy.
3. Once cupcakes are completely cooled, frost with cream cheese frosting.
4. Optionally, sprinkle with additional ground cinnamon or nutmeg for garnish.

ingredients:
For the filling:
1 lb boneless, skinless chicken breasts, diced
2 tbsp olive oil
1 onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
2 cups diced potatoes
1 cup diced carrots
1 cup frozen peas
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
2 cups chicken broth
1 cup milk
1 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
For the crust:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
1/4 cup ice water
cooking_instructions:
For the filling:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large skillet, heat olive oil over medium heat.
3. Add diced chicken and cook until no longer pink. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add chopped onion and minced garlic. Cook until onion is translucent.
5. Stir in diced potatoes and carrots, cooking until slightly softened.
6. Add frozen peas and cooked chicken back to the skillet.
7. Sprinkle flour over the mixture and stir to coat evenly.
8. Gradually stir in chicken broth and milk, stirring constantly.
9. Add dried thyme, salt, and pepper. Bring mixture to a simmer and cook until thickened.
10. Pour filling into a 9-inch pie dish.
For the crust:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine flour and salt.
2. Cut in cold cubed butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
3. Gradually add ice water, stirring until dough comes together.
4. Roll out dough on a floured surface to fit the size of the pie dish.
5. Place rolled dough over the filling in the pie dish, sealing the edges.
6. Cut slits in the top crust for steam to escape.
7. Bake for 30-35 minutes, or until crust is golden brown.
8. Allow to cool slightly before serving.

ingredients:
1 lb chicken breast, sliced
2 tbsp olive oil
1 onion, sliced
1 bell pepper, sliced
1 tsp chili powder
1/2 tsp paprika
1/2 tsp cumin
1/4 tsp garlic powder
1/4 tsp onion powder
Salt and pepper to taste
Flour tortillas
Optional toppings: shredded cheese, sour cream, guacamole, salsa
cooking_instructions:
1. Heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat.
2. Add sliced chicken breast to the skillet, cooking until browned and no longer pink.
3. Remove chicken from skillet and set aside.
4. In the same skillet, add sliced onion and bell pepper. Cook until softened and slightly caramelized.
5. Return cooked chicken to the skillet.
6. Sprinkle chili powder, paprika, cumin, garlic powder, onion powder, salt, and pepper over the chicken and vegetables. Stir to combine.
7. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, allowing flavors to meld.
8. Serve hot with flour tortillas and optional toppings.

ingredients:
For the crust:
2 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 tsp salt
1 tsp granulated sugar
1 cup unsalted butter, cold and cubed
1/4 cup ice water
For the filling:
6 cups thinly sliced peeled apples (such as Granny Smith)
3/4 cup granulated sugar
2 tbsp all-purpose flour
1 tsp ground cinnamon
1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
1/4 tsp salt
1 tbsp lemon juice
2 tbsp unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
1 egg, beaten (for egg wash)
2 tbsp granulated sugar (for sprinkling)
cooking_instructions:
For the crust:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine flour, salt, and granulated sugar.
2. Cut in cold cubed butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
3. Gradually add ice water, stirring until dough comes together.
4. Divide dough in half, shape into discs, and wrap in plastic wrap. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before using.
For the filling:
1. In a large mixing bowl, combine thinly sliced peeled apples, granulated sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, salt, and lemon juice. Toss until apples are evenly coated.
2. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Roll out one disc of chilled pie dough on a lightly floured surface to fit a 9-inch pie dish.
3. Transfer rolled dough to pie dish and trim excess dough from the edges.
4. Pour apple filling into the prepared pie crust, spreading evenly.
5. Dot the top of the filling with small pieces of butter.
6. Roll out the second disc of chilled pie dough and place over the filling. Trim and crimp the edges to seal.
7. Cut slits in the top crust to allow steam to escape.
8. Brush the top crust with beaten egg and sprinkle with granulated sugar.
9. Place pie on a baking sheet to catch any drips and bake for 45-50 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly.
10. Allow pie to cool completely before slicing and serving.

ingredients:
1 lb ground beef
1 onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 can (10 oz) red enchilada sauce
1 can (4 oz) chopped green chilies
1 can (15 oz) black beans, drained and rinsed
1 cup frozen corn kernels
2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
12 corn tortillas
Salt and pepper to taste
Optional toppings: chopped green onions, sliced black olives, sour cream
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat.
3. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, cooking until onion is translucent.
4. Stir in red enchilada sauce, chopped green chilies, black beans, and frozen corn kernels. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
5. Spread a thin layer of the beef mixture on the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
6. Layer 6 corn tortillas over the beef mixture, overlapping as needed.
7. Spread half of the remaining beef mixture over the tortillas.
8. Sprinkle 1 cup of shredded cheddar cheese over the beef mixture.
9. Repeat with another layer of 6 corn tortillas, remaining beef mixture, and remaining shredded cheddar cheese.
10. Cover with foil and bake for 20-25 minutes, or until heated through and cheese is melted.
11. Remove foil and bake for an additional 5 minutes to lightly brown the cheese.
12. Serve hot with optional toppings.

ingredients:
2 cups shredded zucchini
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
2 tsp baking powder
2 large eggs, beaten
1/2 cup shredded mozzarella cheese
1/2 cup pizza sauce
1/4 cup sliced pepperoni
1/4 cup sliced black olives
1/4 cup chopped green bell pepper
1/4 cup sliced mushrooms
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. Place shredded zucchini in a colander and sprinkle with salt. Let sit for 10 minutes, then squeeze out excess moisture.
3. In a mixing bowl, combine shredded zucchini, flour, grated Parmesan cheese, baking powder, and beaten eggs until well mixed.
4. Spread zucchini mixture evenly in the prepared baking dish.
5. Bake for 20-25 minutes, or until golden brown and set.
6. Remove from oven and spread pizza sauce over the baked zucchini crust.
7. Sprinkle shredded mozzarella cheese over the sauce.
8. Top with sliced pepperoni, black olives, chopped green bell pepper, and sliced mushrooms.
9. Return to oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes, or until cheese is melted and toppings are heated through.
10. Allow to cool slightly before slicing and serving.

ingredients:
For the meat sauce:
1 lb ground beef
1 onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
1 can (14.5 oz) crushed tomatoes
1 can (6 oz) tomato paste
1/2 cup water
2 tsp dried basil
1 tsp dried oregano
1/2 tsp salt
1/4 tsp black pepper
For the cheese filling:
15 oz ricotta cheese
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1 large egg
1 tbsp chopped fresh parsley
Salt and pepper to taste
For assembling:
12 lasagna noodles, cooked according to package instructions
2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
cooking_instructions:
For the meat sauce:
1. In a large skillet, brown ground beef over medium heat.
2. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, cooking until onion is translucent.
3. Stir in crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, water, dried basil, dried oregano, salt, and black pepper.
4. Simmer for 15-20 minutes, stirring occasionally.
For the cheese filling:
1. In a mixing bowl, combine ricotta cheese, grated Parmesan cheese, egg, chopped fresh parsley, salt, and pepper until well mixed.
For assembling:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C). Grease a 9x13 inch baking dish.
2. Spread a thin layer of meat sauce on the bottom of the prepared baking dish.
3. Arrange cooked lasagna noodles over the meat sauce.
4. Spread half of the cheese filling over the noodles.
5. Sprinkle 1 cup of shredded mozzarella cheese over the cheese filling.
6. Repeat layers with remaining noodles, meat sauce, cheese filling, and shredded mozzarella cheese.
7. Sprinkle grated Parmesan cheese over the top layer.
8. Cover with foil and bake for 25 minutes.
9. Remove foil and bake for an additional 25 minutes, or until bubbly and golden brown.
10. Allow to cool slightly before slicing and serving.

ingredients:
1 head cauliflower, chopped
1 onion, chopped
2 cloves garlic, minced
4 cups vegetable broth
1 cup milk
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 cup unsalted butter
1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
Salt and pepper to taste
Optional toppings: crispy bacon, chopped chives, additional shredded cheddar cheese
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large pot, melt butter over medium heat.
2. Add chopped onion and minced garlic, cooking until onion is translucent.
3. Stir in chopped cauliflower and vegetable broth. Bring to a boil, then reduce heat and simmer until cauliflower is tender.
4. In a separate bowl, whisk together milk and flour until smooth.
5. Gradually stir milk mixture into the soup, stirring constantly.
6. Cook and stir until soup has thickened.
7. Stir in shredded cheddar cheese until melted.
8. Season with salt and pepper to taste.
9. Using an immersion blender or transferring to a blender in batches, blend soup until smooth.
10. Serve hot with optional toppings.

ingredients:
4 cups all-purpose flour
2 1/4 tsp active dry yeast
1 1/2 cups warm water
1 tbsp sugar
1 tsp salt
2 tbsp olive oil
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large mixing bowl, dissolve sugar in warm water.
2. Sprinkle yeast over the water and let sit for 5-10 minutes, or until foamy.
3. Stir in salt and olive oil.
4. Gradually add flour, stirring until dough forms.
5. Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead for 8-10 minutes, or until smooth and elastic.
6. Place dough in a greased bowl, turning to coat.
7. Cover with a clean kitchen towel and let rise in a warm place for 1 hour, or until doubled in size.
8. Punch down dough and shape into a loaf.
9. Place loaf in a greased 9x5 inch loaf pan.
10. Cover and let rise for an additional 30 minutes.
11. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
12. Bake bread for 30-35 minutes, or until golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom.
13. Remove bread from pan and let cool on a wire rack before slicing.

ingredients:
For the cupcakes:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp baking powder
1/4 tsp salt
1 tsp ground cinnamon
1/4 tsp ground nutmeg
1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
1/2 cup granulated sugar
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1 large egg
1/2 cup vegetable oil
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 1/2 cups grated zucchini
For the cream cheese frosting:
4 oz cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup unsalted butter, softened
2 cups powdered sugar
1 tsp vanilla extract
cooking_instructions:
For the cupcakes:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Line a muffin tin with cupcake liners.
2. In a mixing bowl, whisk together flour, baking soda, baking powder, salt, cinnamon, and nutmeg.
3. In a separate large bowl, cream together softened butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until light and fluffy.
4. Beat in egg, vegetable oil, and vanilla extract until well combined.
5. Gradually add dry ingredients to wet ingredients, mixing until just combined.
6. Fold in grated zucchini until evenly distributed.
7. Divide batter evenly among cupcake liners, filling each about 2/3 full.
8. Bake for 18-20 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Allow cupcakes to cool in the pan for 5 minutes, then transfer to a wire rack to cool completely.
For the cream cheese frosting:
1. In a mixing bowl, beat together softened cream cheese and butter until smooth and creamy.
2. Gradually add powdered sugar and vanilla extract, beating until smooth and fluffy.
3. Once cupcakes are completely cooled, frost with cream cheese frosting.
4. Optionally, garnish with grated zucchini or a sprinkle of ground cinnamon for decoration.

ingredients:
1 lb ground beef
1/2 cup breadcrumbs
1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1/4 cup ketchup
1/4 cup finely chopped onion
1 large egg, beaten
1/2 tsp garlic powder
1/2 tsp onion powder
1/2 tsp dried thyme
Salt and pepper to taste
For the glaze:
1/4 cup ketchup
2 tbsp brown sugar
1 tbsp apple cider vinegar
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a muffin tin or line with parchment paper liners.
2. In a large mixing bowl, combine ground beef, breadcrumbs, shredded cheddar cheese, ketchup, chopped onion, beaten egg, garlic powder, onion powder, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. Mix until well combined.
3. Divide mixture evenly among muffin cups, pressing down to form mini loaves.
4. In a small bowl, whisk together ketchup, brown sugar, and apple cider vinegar to make the glaze.
5. Brush glaze over the tops of the mini meat loaves.
6. Bake for 25-30 minutes, or until cooked through and internal temperature reaches 160°F (71°C).
7. Allow to cool for a few minutes before serving.

ingredients:
1 pound Italian turkey sausage links, casings removed
1 medium onion, chopped
6 cups reduced-sodium chicken broth
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) diced tomatoes, undrained
1 package (9 ounces) refrigerated cheese tortellini
1 package (6 ounces) fresh baby spinach, coarsely chopped
2 tablespoons minced fresh basil or 2 teaspoons dried basil
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/2 cup shredded Parmesan cheese
cooking_instructions:
1. Crumble sausage into a Dutch oven; add onion.
2. Cook and stir over medium heat until meat is no longer pink.
3. Add broth and tomatoes; bring to a boil.
4. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
5. Return to a boil; add tortellini.
6. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 5-8 minutes or until pasta is tender.
7. Stir in spinach, basil, and pepper; cook 2 minutes longer or until spinach is wilted.
8. Serve with cheese.

ingredients:
1-1/4 cups graham cracker crumbs
1/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup butter, melted
FILLING:
3 egg yolks
1 can (14 ounces) sweetened condensed milk
1/2 cup key lime juice
TOPPING:
1 cup heavy whipping cream
3 tablespoons confectioners' sugar
Additional graham cracker crumbs and lime slices, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a small bowl, combine cracker crumbs and sugar; stir in butter.
3. Press onto the bottom and up the sides of a greased 9-in. pie plate.
4. Bake 10-12 minutes or until lightly browned.
5. Cool on a wire rack.
6. For filling, in a large bowl, beat yolks until slightly thickened.
7. Gradually beat in milk and lime juice.
8. Pour into crust.
9. Bake 15-20 minutes or until set.
10. Cool on a wire rack 1 hour.
11. Refrigerate at least 3 hours before serving.
12. In a large bowl, beat cream until it begins to thicken.
13. Add confectioners' sugar; beat until soft peaks form.
14. Spread or pipe over pie.
15. If desired, sprinkle with additional crumbs and garnish with lime slices.

ingredients:
1-1/2 pounds ground beef
1 cup chopped green pepper
1/2 cup chopped onion
3 cups water
1 can (28 ounces) crushed tomatoes, undrained
1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed tomato soup, undiluted
1 can (10 ounces) diced tomatoes and green chilies, undrained
2 teaspoons sugar
2 teaspoons beef bouillon granules
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 cup cooked long grain rice
cooking_instructions:
1. In a Dutch oven, cook beef, green pepper, and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
2. Stir in the water, tomatoes, soup, tomatoes and chilies, sugar, bouillon, salt, and pepper.
3. Bring to a boil.
4. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 30 minutes.
5. Stir in rice; heat through.

ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
2 cups sugar
1/2 cup baking cocoa
1-1/2 teaspoons baking soda
1-1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
2 large eggs, room temperature
1 cup whole milk
1/2 cup canola oil
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 cup boiling water
CHOCOLATE FROSTING:
1/2 cup butter, cubed
4 cups confectioners' sugar
1/2 cup baking cocoa
1/4 cup whole milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease and flour two 9-in. round baking pans.
2. In a large bowl, whisk the first six ingredients.
3. Add eggs, milk, oil, and vanilla; beat on medium speed 2 minutes.
4. Stir in water (batter will be thin).
5. Transfer to prepared pans. Bake 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in center comes out clean.
6. Cool in pans 10 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.
7. For frosting, in a large bowl, beat butter until creamy.
8. Beat in confectioners' sugar, cocoa, milk, and vanilla until smooth.
9. Spread frosting between layers and over top and sides of cake.

ingredients: #N/A
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large bowl, combine the first seven ingredients.
2. Transfer to an ungreased 9x5-in. loaf pan.
3. Combine topping ingredients; spread over loaf.
4. Bake 60-65 minutes or until no pink remains and a thermometer reads 160°. Drain.
5. Let stand 10 minutes before slicing.

ingredients:
1 package yellow cake mix
1 can (11 ounces) mandarin oranges, undrained
4 large eggs
1/4 cup vegetable oil
1 can (8 ounces) crushed pineapple, undrained
1 package (3.4 ounces) instant vanilla pudding mix
1 cup cold milk
1 carton (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine cake mix, oranges with juice, eggs, and oil; beat on low speed for 2 minutes.
2. Pour into a greased 13x9-inch baking pan.
3. Bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
4. Cool completely on a wire rack.
5. For the topping, in a large bowl, beat pineapple with juice and pudding mix on low speed for 2 minutes. Gradually beat in milk. Fold in whipped topping. Spread over cake.
6. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

ingredients:
1 package (16 ounces) spaghetti
1 pound ground beef
1 jar (26 ounces) spaghetti sauce
2 cups shredded mozzarella cheese
1/4 cup grated Parmesan cheese
cooking_instructions:
1. Cook spaghetti according to package directions; drain.
2. In a skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
3. Stir in spaghetti sauce and cooked spaghetti.
4. Transfer to a greased 13x9-inch baking dish.
5. Sprinkle with cheeses.
6. Bake, uncovered, at 350°F for 30-35 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

ingredients:
1 cup all-purpose flour
1 cup cornmeal
1/4 cup sugar
4 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 large eggs
1 cup 2% milk
1/2 cup butter, melted
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the flour, cornmeal, sugar, baking powder, and salt.
2. In another bowl, whisk the eggs, milk, and melted butter.
3. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.
4. Pour into a greased 9-inch square baking pan.
5. Bake at 425°F for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Serve warm.

ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
2 cups sugar
3/4 cup baking cocoa
2 teaspoons baking soda
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 large eggs
1 cup strong brewed coffee, cooled
1 cup buttermilk
1/2 cup canola oil
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F. Grease and flour a 13x9-inch baking pan.
2. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, cocoa, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
3. Add eggs, coffee, buttermilk, oil, and vanilla; beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.
4. Pour into prepared pan.
5. Bake for 35-40 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Cool completely on a wire rack before frosting.

ingredients:
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (6 ounces each)
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
1/2 cup water
1/4 cup white wine or chicken broth
1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms
cooking_instructions:
1. Place chicken in a greased 13x9-inch baking dish; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
2. In a small bowl, combine the soup, water, and wine or broth; pour over chicken.
3. Top with mushrooms.
4. Bake, uncovered, at 375°F for 30-35 minutes or until a thermometer reads 170°F.

ingredients:
4 large eggs
2 cups sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2-1/4 cups all-purpose flour
2-1/4 teaspoons baking powder
1/4 teaspoon salt
1 cup 2% milk
10 tablespoons butter
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, beat eggs on high speed for 5 minutes or until thick and lemon-colored.
2. Gradually add sugar, beating until mixture is light and fluffy. Beat in vanilla.
3. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt; gradually add to batter just until combined.
4. In a small saucepan, heat milk and butter just until butter is melted.
5. Gradually add to batter; beat just until combined.
6. Pour into a greased 13x9-inch baking pan.
7. Bake at 350°F for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
8. Cool on a wire rack.

ingredients:
1 package (16 ounces) elbow macaroni
4 cups coleslaw mix
1/2 cup chopped onion
1 cup mayonnaise
1/4 cup sugar
1/4 cup cider vinegar
1/4 cup milk
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
cooking_instructions:
1. Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain and rinse in cold water.
2. In a large bowl, combine the macaroni, coleslaw mix, and onion.
3. In a small bowl, whisk the mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, milk, salt, and pepper.
4. Pour over macaroni mixture and toss to coat.
5. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

ingredients:
3 cups diced peeled potatoes
1/2 cup chopped onion
1/2 cup chopped celery
1/4 cup chopped green pepper
1/4 cup butter
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
3 cups milk
2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
2 cups cubed fully cooked ham
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the potatoes, onion, celery, and green pepper; add water to cover.
2. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 10-15 minutes or until vegetables are tender. Drain and set aside.
3. In the same saucepan, melt butter; stir in flour, salt, and pepper until smooth.
4. Gradually add milk. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
5. Reduce heat; stir in cheese until melted.
6. Add ham and reserved vegetables; heat through.

ingredients:
5 cups sliced peeled tart apples
3/4 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 cup quick-cooking oats
1/3 cup butter, softened
3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
3/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
Vanilla ice cream, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. Place apples in a greased 8-inch square baking dish.
2. In a bowl, combine the brown sugar, flour, oats, butter, cinnamon, and nutmeg until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs; sprinkle over apples.
3. Bake at 350°F for 35-40 minutes or until apples are tender.
4. Serve warm with ice cream if desired.

ingredients:
1 package (8 ounces) smoked sausage, sliced
1 medium onion, chopped
1 medium green pepper, chopped
1 celery rib, chopped
2 cans (14-1/2 ounces each) diced tomatoes, undrained
1-1/2 cups water
1 cup uncooked long grain rice
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
cooking_instructions:
1. In a Dutch oven, cook sausage over medium heat until lightly browned; drain.
2. Add the onion, green pepper, and celery; cook and stir for 5 minutes or until tender.
3. Stir in the tomatoes, water, rice, salt, pepper, thyme, and cayenne.
4. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 20-25 minutes or until rice is tender.

ingredients:
1-1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
3 large ripe bananas
3/4 cup sugar
1 egg
1/3 cup vegetable oil
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F. Grease muffin cups or line with muffin liners.
2. In a large bowl, combine flour, baking soda, baking powder, and salt.
3. In another bowl, mash bananas; add sugar, egg, and oil. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.
4. Fill prepared muffin cups three-fourths full.
5. Bake for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack.

ingredients:
9 lasagna noodles, cooked and drained
1/4 cup butter
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 cups 2% milk
2 cups shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese, divided
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1/2 teaspoon dried basil
1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) diced tomatoes, drained
1 can (6 ounces) crabmeat, drained, flaked, and cartilage removed
1/2 pound cooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/2 cup chopped green onions
cooking_instructions:
1. In a saucepan, melt butter. Stir in flour and salt until smooth. Gradually add milk. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes.
2. Reduce heat; stir in 1 cup mozzarella cheese, Parmesan cheese, basil, oregano, garlic powder, and pepper until cheese is melted.
3. Spread 1/2 cup sauce into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish. Layer with three noodles, a third of the remaining sauce, tomatoes, crab, and shrimp. Repeat layers twice.
4. Cover and bake at 350°F for 40 minutes. Uncover; sprinkle with remaining mozzarella cheese and green onions. Bake 5-10 minutes longer or until bubbly and cheese is melted. Let stand for 15 minutes before cutting.

ingredients:
4 cups seedless red grapes
4 cups seedless green grapes
1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened
1 cup sour cream
1/2 cup sugar
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
1 cup chopped pecans, toasted
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine grapes.
2. In a separate bowl, beat cream cheese, sour cream, sugar, and vanilla until blended.
3. Add to grapes; toss to coat.
4. Refrigerate until serving.
5. Just before serving, sprinkle with pecans.

ingredients:
1-1/4 cups all-purpose flour
1/2 cup butter, softened
1/2 cup chopped peanuts
1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened
1 cup confectioners' sugar
1 carton (16 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed, divided
1-1/2 cups creamy peanut butter
1 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1-1/2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
1-1/2 cups milk
1 tablespoon butter
cooking_instructions:
1. In a bowl, combine flour, butter, and peanuts until crumbly.
2. Press into an ungreased 13x9-inch baking dish.
3. Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.
4. Cool on a wire rack.
5. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and confectioners' sugar until smooth.
6. Fold in 1-3/4 cups whipped topping; spread over crust.
7. In another large bowl, beat peanut butter, sugar, and vanilla until smooth.
8. Spread over cream cheese layer.
9. In a microwave, melt chocolate chips and butter; stir until smooth.
10. Gradually stir in milk until smooth; cool.
11. Spread over peanut butter layer.
12. Spread remaining whipped topping over chocolate layer.
13. Refrigerate for at least 1 hour before serving.

ingredients:
1 boneless beef chuck roast (3 to 4 pounds)
1 tablespoon canola oil
1 cup water
1/4 cup Worcestershire sauce
1 tablespoon beef bouillon granules
1 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
1 teaspoon dried thyme
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
1/2 teaspoon pepper
6 medium potatoes, peeled and quartered
1 pound baby carrots
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1/4 cup cold water
cooking_instructions:
1. In a Dutch oven, brown roast in oil over medium heat; drain.
2. Add the water, Worcestershire sauce, bouillon, rosemary, thyme, garlic powder, and pepper; bring to a boil.
3. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 2-1/2 hours.
4. Add potatoes and carrots; cover and cook for 1 hour or until meat and vegetables are tender.
5. Remove meat and vegetables to a serving platter and keep warm.
6. Skim fat from pan juices; measure 2-1/2 cups, adding water if necessary. Return to the pan.
7. Combine cornstarch and cold water until smooth; gradually stir into the pan.
8. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
9. Serve with roast and vegetables.

ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1-1/2 cups sugar
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon baking powder
1/4 teaspoon ground cloves
2 large eggs
1 cup canned pumpkin
1/2 cup canola oil
1/2 cup water
1/2 cup chopped walnuts, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking soda, cinnamon, salt, baking powder, and cloves.
2. In another bowl, whisk the eggs, pumpkin, oil, and water.
3. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.
4. Fold in walnuts if desired.
5. Pour into a greased 9x5-inch loaf pan.
6. Bake at 350°F for 60-70 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
7. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pan to a wire rack.

ingredients:
1 pound ground beef
1 can (15 ounces) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 cup salsa
1 can (6 ounces) tomato paste
1 can (4 ounces) chopped green chilies
1 envelope taco seasoning
1/2 cup water
6 flour tortillas (8 inches)
2 cups shredded Mexican cheese blend
Optional toppings: shredded lettuce, chopped tomatoes, sliced ripe olives, sour cream, guacamole
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large skillet, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
2. Stir in the beans, salsa, tomato paste, chilies, taco seasoning, and water.
3. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
4. Spread 1 cup meat mixture in a greased 13x9-inch baking dish.
5. Top with two tortillas, a third of the remaining meat mixture, and 2/3 cup cheese.
6. Repeat layers twice.
7. Cover and bake at 350°F for 25-30 minutes or until heated through.
8. Let stand for 5 minutes before cutting.
9. Serve with optional toppings if desired.

ingredients:
1/2 cup butter, softened
2 cups sugar
3 large eggs
1-1/2 cups mashed ripe bananas (about 3 medium)
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
Pinch salt
Frosting:
1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup butter, softened
4 cups confectioners' sugar
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
2. Beat in eggs, bananas, and vanilla.
3. Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; gradually add to creamed mixture.
4. Pour into a greased 15x10x1-inch baking pan.
5. Bake at 350°F for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Cool completely on a wire rack.
7. For frosting, in a small bowl, beat cream cheese and butter until fluffy.
8. Add confectioners' sugar and vanilla; beat until smooth.
9. Spread over bars.

ingredients:
1/4 cup butter, cubed
3 garlic cloves, minced
1 pound uncooked medium shrimp, peeled and deveined
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/4 cup lemon juice
1/4 cup minced fresh parsley
Hot cooked linguine or rice
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large skillet, heat butter over medium-high heat. Add garlic; cook and stir for 1 minute.
2. Add shrimp, salt, and pepper; cook and stir until shrimp turn pink.
3. Stir in lemon juice and parsley.
4. Serve with linguine or rice.

ingredients:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1/4 cup sugar
1 cup cold butter, cubed
Filling:
2 cups sugar
7 tablespoons all-purpose flour
1 cup heavy whipping cream
3 large eggs, beaten
5 cups finely chopped fresh or frozen rhubarb, thawed and drained
cooking_instructions:
1. In a bowl, combine flour and sugar; cut in butter until the mixture resembles coarse crumbs.
2. Press into a greased 13x9-inch baking dish.
3. Bake at 350°F for 10 minutes.
4. Meanwhile, for filling, combine sugar and flour in a bowl.
5. Whisk in cream and eggs.
6. Stir in rhubarb.
7. Pour over hot crust.
8. Bake for 40-45 minutes or until custard is set.
9. Cool completely on a wire rack.
10. Cut into bars.

ingredients:
1 (8 oz) package cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup sugar
1/2 tsp vanilla extract
2 eggs
1 (9-inch) graham cracker crust
1/4 cup caramel ice cream topping
1/4 cup chopped pecans
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese, sugar, and vanilla until smooth. Add eggs and beat on low speed just until combined.
3. Pour into crust. Bake for 30-35 minutes or until center is almost set.
4. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes. Carefully run a knife around the edge of the pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer.
5. Refrigerate overnight.
6. Just before serving, drizzle with caramel topping and sprinkle with pecans.

ingredients:
1 lb ground beef
1 small onion, chopped
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 can (10 oz) red enchilada sauce
1 can (4 oz) chopped green chilies
1/2 tsp salt
1/4 tsp pepper
6 flour tortillas (8 inches)
2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
Sour cream and chopped green onions, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large skillet, cook beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
2. Stir in the enchilada sauce, chilies, salt, and pepper; heat through.
3. Spread 1/2 cup beef mixture in each tortilla; roll up and place seam side down in a greased 11x7-in. baking dish.
4. Top with remaining beef mixture and cheese.
5. Bake, uncovered, at 350°F (175°C) for 15-20 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.
6. Serve with sour cream and green onions if desired.

ingredients:
4 cups chopped peeled tart apples
2 cups sugar
1/2 cup vegetable oil
2 large eggs
2 tsp vanilla extract
2 cups all-purpose flour
2 tsp ground cinnamon
1 tsp baking soda
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 cup chopped walnuts, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the apples, sugar, oil, eggs, and vanilla.
2. In another bowl, whisk together the flour, cinnamon, baking soda, and salt; gradually add to apple mixture and mix well.
3. Stir in walnuts if desired.
4. Spread into a greased 13x9-in. baking dish.
5. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Cool on a wire rack.

ingredients:
1 can (15-1/4 oz) whole kernel corn, drained
1 can (14-3/4 oz) cream-style corn
1 cup sour cream
1/2 cup butter, melted
2 large eggs, beaten
1 package (8-1/2 oz) cornbread/muffin mix
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine all ingredients.
2. Pour into a greased 11x7-in. baking dish.
3. Bake, uncovered, at 350°F (175°C) for 45-50 minutes or until set and lightly browned.

ingredients:
1 lb ground beef
1 medium onion, chopped
1 can (28 oz) diced tomatoes, undrained
1 can (15 oz) black beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 oz) solid-pack pumpkin
1 can (14-1/2 oz) beef broth
1 can (8 oz) tomato sauce
1 cup frozen corn
1 small sweet red pepper, chopped
1 small sweet yellow pepper, chopped
1 small zucchini, chopped
3 tbsp chili powder
2 tsp dried parsley flakes
1-1/2 tsp ground cumin
1-1/2 tsp dried oregano
1/2 tsp salt
1/2 tsp pepper
cooking_instructions:
1. In a Dutch oven, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
2. Stir in the remaining ingredients. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 30 minutes or until heated through, stirring occasionally.

ingredients:
4 medium potatoes, peeled and thinly sliced
1 small onion, thinly sliced
3 tbsp all-purpose flour
1-1/2 cups milk
1-1/2 cups shredded cheddar cheese
Salt and pepper to taste
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a greased 1-1/2 qt. baking dish, layer half of the potatoes and onion. Sprinkle with half of the flour.
3. Pour half of the milk over the top and sprinkle with half of the cheese. Season with salt and pepper.
4. Repeat layers.
5. Cover and bake for 60-70 minutes or until potatoes are tender.

ingredients:
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (4 ounces each)
1/2 cup shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
1/4 cup chopped seeded tomato
2 tablespoons minced fresh basil
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
2 tablespoons balsamic vinaigrette
cooking_instructions:
1. Flatten chicken to 1/4-in. thickness.
2. In a large nonstick skillet coated with cooking spray, cook chicken over medium heat for 4-5 minutes on each side or until juices run clear.
3. Top with cheese, tomato, basil, salt, and pepper.
4. Drizzle with vinaigrette. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes or until cheese is melted.

ingredients:
6 cups cubed peeled potatoes
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) chicken broth
1 medium carrot, grated
1/2 cup chopped onion
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
3 cups milk
1/4 cup butter, cubed
3 tablespoons all-purpose flour
2 cups (8 ounces) shredded cheddar cheese
8 bacon strips, cooked and crumbled
4 green onions, chopped
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large saucepan, combine the potatoes, broth, carrot, onion, salt, and pepper.
2. Cover and cook over medium heat for 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
3. Stir in milk; heat through but do not boil.
4. In a small skillet, melt butter; stir in flour until smooth.
5. Gradually add to soup.
6. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
7. Remove from the heat; stir in cheese until melted.
8. Garnish with bacon and onions.

ingredients:
3 large ripe bananas, mashed
1/3 cup melted butter
3/4 cup sugar
1 egg, beaten
1 tsp vanilla extract
1 tsp baking soda
1/4 tsp salt
1 1/2 cups gluten-free all-purpose flour
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 4x8-inch loaf pan.
2. In a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas with a fork until smooth.
3. Stir the melted butter into the mashed bananas.
4. Mix in the baking soda and salt.
5. Stir in the sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla extract.
6. Mix in the gluten-free flour.
7. Pour the batter into your prepared loaf pan.
8. Bake for 1 hour or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out clean.
9. Remove from oven and cool completely on a rack. Remove from pan and slice to serve.

ingredients:
3/4 cup unsweetened pineapple juice
1/2 cup soy sauce
1/2 cup packed brown sugar
1/4 cup ketchup
1/4 cup chicken broth
2-1/2 tsp minced fresh gingerroot
1-1/2 tsp minced garlic
24 boneless skinless chicken thighs (about 6 ounces each)
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the first seven ingredients.
2. Reserve 1-1/3 cups marinade for basting; cover and refrigerate.
3. Divide remaining marinade between two large resealable plastic bags.
4. Add 12 chicken thighs to each; seal bags and turn to coat.
5. Refrigerate for 8 hours or overnight, turning occasionally.
6. Drain and discard marinade from chicken.
7. Grill chicken, covered, over medium heat for 6-8 minutes on each side or until no longer pink; baste occasionally with reserved marinade during the last 5 minutes.

ingredients:
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
3 1/2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 tablespoon white sugar
1 1/4 cups milk
1 egg
3 tablespoons butter, melted
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, sift together the flour, baking powder, salt, and sugar.
2. Make a well in the center and pour in the milk, egg, and melted butter; mix until smooth.
3. Heat a lightly oiled griddle or frying pan over medium-high heat.
4. Pour or scoop the batter onto the griddle, using approximately 1/4 cup for each pancake.
5. Brown on both sides and serve hot.

ingredients:
6 boneless skinless chicken thighs (about 1-1/2 pounds)
1/4 cup soy sauce
1/4 cup hoisin sauce
3 tablespoons honey
2 tablespoons sesame oil
2 tablespoons ketchup
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 teaspoon grated fresh ginger
1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
cooking_instructions:
1. Place chicken in a 4- or 5-qt. slow cooker.
2. In a small bowl, mix remaining ingredients; pour over chicken. Cook, covered, on low 4-5 hours or until chicken is tender.

ingredients:
4 large eggs
1-2/3 cups sugar
1 cup canola oil
1 can (15 ounces) pumpkin
2 cups all-purpose flour
2 teaspoons ground cinnamon
2 teaspoons baking powder
1 teaspoon baking soda
1 teaspoon salt
1 package (3 ounces) cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup butter, softened
2 cups confectioners' sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, beat the eggs, sugar, oil, and pumpkin until well blended.
2. Combine the flour, cinnamon, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; gradually add to pumpkin mixture and mix well.
3. Pour into an ungreased 15x10x1-in. baking pan.
4. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25-30 minutes or until set.
5. Cool completely.
6. For frosting, beat the cream cheese, butter, confectioners' sugar, and vanilla in a small bowl until smooth.
7. Spread over bars. Store in the refrigerator.

ingredients:
1 pound ground beef
1/4 cup chopped onion
1/4 cup chopped green pepper
1/4 cup chopped celery
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) diced tomatoes, undrained
1 cup sliced carrots
1 cup cubed peeled potatoes
2 cups beef broth
1 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded cheddar cheese
1/2 cup milk
cooking_instructions:
1. In a Dutch oven, cook the beef, onion, green pepper, and celery over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
2. Stir in the tomatoes, carrots, potatoes, broth, salt, and pepper.
3. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
4. Stir in cheese and milk; cook and stir over low heat until cheese is melted.

ingredients:
1-1/4 cups sugar
1/2 cup butter, softened
2 eggs
1-1/2 cups mashed ripe bananas (about 3 medium)
1/2 cup buttermilk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2-1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, cream sugar and butter.
2. Beat in eggs, bananas, buttermilk, and vanilla.
3. Combine flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt; stir into creamed mixture just until moistened.
4. Fold in nuts.
5. Pour into three greased 8x4-in. loaf pans.
6. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45-55 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
7. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks.

ingredients:
1-1/4 cups crushed chocolate wafers (about 22 wafers)
1/4 cup sugar
1/3 cup butter, melted
2 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, softened
3/4 cup sugar
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
3 large eggs, lightly beaten
1 cup sour cream
2 cups chopped peanut butter cups, divided
1/4 cup hot fudge ice cream topping, warmed
cooking_instructions:
1. In a small bowl, combine the wafer crumbs and sugar; stir in butter.
2. Press onto the bottom of a greased 9-in. springform pan; set aside.
3. In a large bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until smooth.
4. Beat in vanilla.
5. Add eggs; beat on low speed just until combined.
6. Fold in sour cream and 1 cup peanut butter cups.
7. Pour over crust.
8. Place pan on a baking sheet.
9. Bake at 325°F (160°C) for 45-50 minutes or until center is almost set.
10. Cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes.
11. Carefully run a knife around edge of pan to loosen; cool 1 hour longer.
12. Refrigerate overnight.
13. Remove sides of pan.
14. Just before serving, sprinkle with remaining peanut butter cups.
15. Drizzle with hot fudge topping.

ingredients:
Pastry for single-crust pie (9 inches)
3/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon ground nutmeg
1/4 teaspoon salt
6 cups thinly sliced peeled tart apples
3/4 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
1/2 cup quick-cooking oats
1/3 cup cold butter, cubed
Vanilla ice cream, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. On a lightly floured surface, roll out pastry to fit a 9-in. pie plate. Transfer pastry to pie plate.
3. In a large bowl, combine the sugar, flour, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
4. Add apples; toss to coat.
5. Arrange in crust.
6. For topping, in a small bowl, combine brown sugar, flour, and oats; cut in butter until crumbly.
7. Sprinkle over filling.
8. Bake at 375°F (190°C) for 45-55 minutes or until apples are tender.
9. Serve warm, with ice cream if desired.

ingredients:
4 boneless skinless chicken breast halves (4 ounces each)
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, sliced
1 medium green pepper, sliced
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) diced tomatoes, undrained
1/2 cup shredded cheddar cheese
cooking_instructions:
1. Flatten chicken to 1/4-in. thickness; sprinkle with salt and pepper.
2. In a large skillet, cook chicken in oil over medium heat for 4-5 minutes on each side or until a thermometer reads 170°F.
3. Remove and keep warm.
4. In the same skillet, sauté onion and green pepper until tender.
5. Add tomatoes; cook 2 minutes longer.
6. Return chicken to skillet.
7. Sprinkle with cheese.
8. Cover and cook for 2-3 minutes or until cheese is melted.

ingredients:
1/3 cup melted butter
1 cup sugar
3 tablespoons lemon juice
2 eggs
1 1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 cup milk
2 tablespoons grated lemon zest
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries
2 tablespoons lemon juice
1/4 cup sugar
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 9x5-inch loaf pan.
2. In a mixing bowl, beat together butter, 1 cup sugar, juice, and eggs.
3. Combine flour, baking powder, and salt; stir into egg mixture alternately with milk.
4. Fold in lemon zest, nuts, and blueberries.
5. Pour batter into prepared pan.
6. Bake in preheated oven for 60-70 minutes, until a toothpick inserted into the center of the loaf comes out clean.
7. Cool bread in pan for 10 minutes.
8. Meanwhile, combine lemon juice and 1/4 cup sugar in a small bowl.
9. Remove bread from pan and drizzle with glaze. Cool on a wire rack.

ingredients:
1 pound ground beef
1 medium onion, chopped
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 can (29 ounces) tomato sauce
1 cup water
1 can (6 ounces) tomato paste
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon dried oregano
1 package (8 ounces) no-cook lasagna noodles
4 cups (16 ounces) shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
1-1/2 cups (12 ounces) 4% cottage cheese
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
cooking_instructions:
1. In a skillet, cook beef, onion, and garlic over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
2. Add tomato sauce, water, tomato paste, salt, and oregano; mix well.
3. Spread a fourth of the meat sauce in an ungreased 5- or 6-qt. slow cooker.
4. Arrange a third of the noodles over sauce (break the noodles if necessary).
5. Combine the cheeses; spoon a third of the mixture over noodles.
6. Repeat layers twice.
7. Top with remaining meat sauce.
8. Cover and cook on low for 4-5 hours or until noodles are tender.
9. Sprinkle with additional Parmesan cheese if desired.

ingredients:
8 ounces uncooked linguine
1/4 cup butter, cubed
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) diced tomatoes, undrained
1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
1/4 cup minced fresh basil or 1 tablespoon dried basil
1/4 teaspoon pepper
cooking_instructions:
1. Cook linguine according to package directions.
2. Meanwhile, in a large skillet, melt butter over medium heat.
3. Add garlic; cook and stir 1 minute.
4. Stir in the tomatoes, soup, cheese, basil, and pepper.
5. Bring to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 3-4 minutes or until heated through.
6. Drain linguine; toss with sauce.

ingredients:
6 pork loin chops (3/4 inch thick)
1 tablespoon vegetable oil
1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
1/2 cup milk
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
4 cups thinly sliced peeled potatoes
1/2 cup chopped onion
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large skillet, brown pork chops in oil.
2. In a bowl, combine soup, milk, salt, and pepper.
3. Place half of the potatoes and onion in a greased 13x9-in. baking dish.
4. Pour half of the soup mixture over the top.
5. Top with pork chops, remaining potatoes, onion, and soup mixture.
6. Cover and bake at 350°F (175°C) for 1 hour.
7. Uncover; bake 30 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender.

ingredients:
1 broiler/fryer chicken (3-1/2 to 4 pounds), cut up
2 quarts water
2 celery ribs with leaves, chopped
1 medium onion, chopped
1 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
DUMPLINGS:
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 tablespoon baking powder
1 teaspoon salt
1 cup whole milk
1/4 cup minced fresh parsley
cooking_instructions:
1. In a Dutch oven, combine the first six ingredients; bring to a boil.
2. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 2 hours or until chicken is tender.
3. Remove chicken and set aside until cool enough to handle.
4. Strain broth, reserving 3 cups. Return the broth and chicken to the pan; bring to a boil.
5. For dumplings, combine the flour, baking powder, and salt in a bowl.
6. Stir in milk and parsley just until moistened.
7. Drop by tablespoonfuls into simmering broth.
8. Cover and simmer for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick inserted into a dumpling comes out clean (do not lift the cover while simmering).

ingredients:
2-1/4 cups all-purpose flour
2 teaspoons ground ginger
1 teaspoon baking soda
3/4 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/2 teaspoon ground cloves
1/4 teaspoon salt
3/4 cup butter, softened
1 cup sugar
1 egg
1 tablespoon water
1/4 cup molasses
2 tablespoons sugar
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Sift together the flour, ginger, baking soda, cinnamon, cloves, and salt. Set aside.
2. In a large bowl, cream together the butter and 1 cup sugar until light and fluffy.
3. Beat in the egg, then stir in the water and molasses.
4. Gradually stir the sifted ingredients into the molasses mixture.
5. Shape dough into walnut-sized balls and roll them in the remaining 2 tablespoons of sugar.
6. Place the cookies 2 inches apart onto an ungreased cookie sheet and flatten slightly.
7. Bake for 8 to 10 minutes in the preheated oven. Allow cookies to cool on baking sheet for 5 minutes before removing to a wire rack to cool completely. Store in an airtight container.

ingredients:
1/4 cup sour cream
3 tablespoons mayonnaise
2 tablespoons sugar
1 tablespoon cider vinegar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
4 cups shredded cabbage
1/2 cup shredded carrot
1/4 cup chopped sweet red pepper
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, whisk together the sour cream, mayonnaise, sugar, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
2. Add the cabbage, carrot, and red pepper; toss to coat.
3. Cover and refrigerate until serving.

ingredients:
1 cup butter
2 cups packed brown sugar
1 cup light corn syrup
1 can (14 ounces) sweetened condensed milk
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 teaspoon salt
2 cups (12 ounces) semisweet chocolate chips
cooking_instructions:
1. Line a 13x9-in. pan with foil and grease the foil with 1 tablespoon butter; set aside.
2. In a heavy saucepan, melt the remaining butter over medium heat.
3. Add brown sugar and corn syrup; bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.
4. Boil for 5 minutes, stirring occasionally.
5. Stir in milk.
6. Cook and stir until a candy thermometer reads 248°F (firm-ball stage), about 30-40 minutes.
7. Remove from the heat; stir in vanilla and salt.
8. Pour into prepared pan.
9. Cool completely.
10. Using foil, lift candy out of the pan; remove foil.
11. Cut candy into 1-in. squares.
12. In a microwave, melt chocolate chips; stir until smooth.
13. Dip candy squares into chocolate; allow excess to drip off.
14. Place on waxed paper; let stand until set.

ingredients:
1/2 cup chopped celery
1/4 cup chopped onion
2 tablespoons butter
3 cups chicken broth
1/2 cup shredded carrots
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/4 teaspoon dried thyme
1/4 teaspoon poultry seasoning
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1 cup cooked wild rice
1 cup cubed cooked chicken
2 cups half-and-half
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large saucepan, sauté celery and onion in butter until tender.
2. Add broth, carrots, and seasonings; bring to a boil.
3. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15 minutes.
4. Combine flour and half-and-half until smooth; gradually stir into soup.
5. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
6. Add rice and chicken; heat through.

ingredients:
1 cup Guinness stout
1 cup butter, cubed
3/4 cup baking cocoa
2 cups all-purpose flour
2 cups sugar
1-1/2 teaspoons baking soda
3/4 teaspoon salt
2 eggs
2/3 cup sour cream
FROSTING:
1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened
1-1/2 cups confectioners' sugar
1/2 cup heavy whipping cream
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Grease a 9-in. springform pan and line the bottom with parchment paper; set aside.
3. In a large saucepan, heat Guinness and butter until butter is melted; remove from heat.
4. Whisk in cocoa until smooth. Cool slightly.
5. In a large bowl, combine the flour, sugar, baking soda, and salt; set aside.
6. In a small bowl, beat eggs and sour cream until smooth; add to beer mixture.
7. Gradually add to dry ingredients, beating until well blended.
8. Pour into prepared pan.
9. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
10. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.
11. Remove cake from pan and place on a platter or cake stand.
12. For frosting, in a large bowl, beat cream cheese until fluffy.
13. Add confectioners' sugar and cream; beat until smooth and creamy.
14. Spread over top of cake. Refrigerate until serving.

ingredients:
1 tablespoon canola oil
1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts, cubed
1 medium onion, chopped
1-1/2 teaspoons garlic powder
2 cans (15-1/2 ounces each) great northern beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) chicken broth
2 cans (4 ounces each) chopped green chilies
1 teaspoon salt
1 teaspoon ground cumin
1 teaspoon dried oregano
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1/4 teaspoon cayenne pepper
1 cup (8 ounces) sour cream
1/2 cup heavy whipping cream
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large saucepan, heat oil over medium heat.
2. Add chicken, onion, and garlic powder; cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink.
3. Add the beans, broth, chilies, and seasonings. Bring to a boil.
4. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 30 minutes.
5. Remove from the heat; stir in sour cream and cream. Serve immediately.

ingredients:
1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of chicken soup, undiluted
1 cup (8 ounces) sour cream
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded cheddar cheese, divided
1 cup (4 ounces) shredded Monterey Jack cheese, divided
2 cups cubed cooked chicken
1 can (4 ounces) chopped green chilies
1/4 cup chopped onion
1/4 cup chopped green pepper
1/4 cup chopped sweet red pepper
8 flour tortillas (6 inches)
1 can (10 ounces) enchilada sauce
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the soup, sour cream, 1/2 cup cheddar cheese, and 1/2 cup Monterey Jack cheese.
2. Stir in the chicken, chilies, onion, and peppers.
3. Spoon about 1/3 cup off-center on each tortilla; roll up and place seam side down in a greased 13x9-in. baking dish.
4. Pour enchilada sauce over top; sprinkle with remaining cheeses.
5. Bake, uncovered, at 350°F (175°C) for 20-25 minutes or until heated through and cheese is melted.

recipe_name: Banana Bars with Cream Cheese Frosting
ingredients:
1/2 cup butter, softened
2 cups sugar
3 large eggs
1-1/2 cups mashed ripe bananas (about 4 medium)
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
PINCH SALT
FROSTING:
1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened
1/2 cup butter, softened
4 cups confectioners' sugar
2 teaspoons vanilla extract
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
2. Beat in eggs, bananas, and vanilla.
3. Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; gradually add to creamed mixture.
4. Pour into a greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan.
5. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Cool completely.
7. For frosting, in a small bowl, beat cream cheese and butter until fluffy.
8. Add confectioners' sugar and vanilla; beat until smooth.
9. Frost bars.

ingredients:
12 slices day-old bread, cut into 1-inch cubes
2 packages (8 ounces each) cream cheese, cubed
1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries
12 large eggs
2 cups milk
1/3 cup maple syrup
BLUEBERRY SAUCE:
1 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cornstarch
1 cup water
1 cup fresh or frozen blueberries
1 tablespoon butter
Additional maple syrup
cooking_instructions:
1. Place half of the bread cubes in a greased 13x9-in. baking dish.
2. Distribute cream cheese cubes and blueberries evenly over bread.
3. Top with remaining bread.
4. In a large bowl, beat eggs, milk, and syrup.
5. Pour over bread mixture.
6. Cover and chill 8 hours or overnight.
7. Remove from refrigerator 30 minutes before baking.
8. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
9. Cover and bake 30 minutes.
10. Uncover and bake 25-30 minutes more or until golden brown and the center is set.
11. Meanwhile, in a saucepan, combine sugar and cornstarch.
12. Stir in water until smooth.
13. Add blueberries.
14. Bring to a boil; reduce heat and simmer for 8-10 minutes or until berries have burst.
15. Stir in butter until melted.
16. Serve French toast with blueberry sauce and additional syrup.

ingredients:
4 bacon strips, diced
1 medium onion, chopped
2 tablespoons all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon dried thyme
1/4 teaspoon pepper
2 cups half-and-half cream
2 cans (6-1/2 ounces each) minced clams, undrained
2 medium potatoes, peeled and cubed
1 cup chicken broth
1 bay leaf
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large saucepan, cook bacon until crisp.
2. Remove bacon, reserving 1 tablespoon drippings.
3. Drain bacon on paper towels.
4. In the drippings, sauté onion until tender.
5. Stir in flour, salt, thyme, and pepper until blended.
6. Gradually add cream.
7. Drain clams, reserving liquid; set clams aside.
8. Add the clam liquid, potatoes, broth, and bay leaf to the saucepan; bring to a boil.
9. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.
10. Discard bay leaf.
11. Add clams and heat through.
12. Garnish with bacon.

ingredients:
1 can (20 ounces) crushed pineapple, undrained
1 package yellow cake mix (regular size)
1 package (3.4 ounces) instant vanilla pudding mix
1/2 cup chopped walnuts
1/2 cup flaked coconut
1/2 cup butter, melted
Whipped topping, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the pineapple, cake mix, dry pudding mix, walnuts, and coconut.
3. Spread into a greased 13x9-in. baking dish.
4. Drizzle with butter.
5. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 45-50 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Serve warm or cold with whipped topping if desired.

ingredients:
4 tilapia fillets (6 ounces each)
1/4 cup butter, melted
3 tablespoons lemon juice
1 teaspoon dried parsley flakes
1/4 teaspoon garlic powder
1/4 teaspoon pepper
cooking_instructions:
1. Place fillets in a greased 13x9-in. baking dish.
2. In a small bowl, combine the remaining ingredients; drizzle over fillets.
3. Bake, uncovered, at 425°F (220°C) for 10-15 minutes or until fish flakes easily with a fork.

ingredients:
1 package chocolate cake mix (regular size)
1-1/4 cups water
1/3 cup canola oil
3 large eggs
1 cup strawberry ice cream topping
1 carton (8 ounces) frozen whipped topping, thawed
Fresh strawberries and chocolate curls, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the cake mix, water, oil, and eggs; beat on low speed for 30 seconds. Beat on medium for 2 minutes.
2. Pour into two greased and floured 9-in. round baking pans.
3. Bake at 350°F (175°C) for 25-30 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
4. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.
5. Place one cake layer on a serving plate; spread with ice cream topping.
6. Top with second cake layer.
7. Spread whipped topping over top and sides of cake.
8. Garnish with strawberries and chocolate curls if desired.

ingredients:
1 cup butter, softened
2 cups sugar
1 teaspoon salt
4 large eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/4 teaspoon almond extract
3 cups all-purpose flour
1 can (21 ounces) cherry pie filling
FROSTING:
1 cup confectioners' sugar
1/2 teaspoon vanilla extract
1/2 teaspoon almond extract
2 to 3 tablespoons milk
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large bowl, cream butter, sugar, and salt until light and fluffy.
2. Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition. Beat in extracts.
3. Gradually add flour. Spread 3 cups dough into a greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan.
4. Spread pie filling over crust. Drop remaining dough by teaspoonfuls over filling.
5. Bake 30-35 minutes or until golden brown.
6. Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.
7. In a small bowl, mix confectioners' sugar, extracts, and enough milk to reach desired consistency; drizzle over top.

ingredients:
2 cups elbow macaroni
1/4 cup butter, cubed
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
2 cups 2% milk
2 cups (8 ounces) shredded sharp cheddar cheese
cooking_instructions:
1. Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain.
2. In a saucepan, melt butter.
3. Stir in flour, salt, and pepper until smooth.
4. Gradually add milk.
5. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
6. Reduce heat; stir in cheese until melted.
7. Add macaroni; stir to coat.

ingredients:
1 cup butter, softened
1 cup packed brown sugar
1/2 cup sugar
2 large eggs
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
2 cups all-purpose flour
1 teaspoon baking soda
1/2 teaspoon salt
3 cups old-fashioned oats
1-1/2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, cream butter and sugars until light and fluffy.
3. Beat in eggs and vanilla.
4. Combine the flour, baking soda, and salt; gradually add to creamed mixture and mix well.
5. Stir in oats and chocolate chips.
6. Drop by rounded tablespoonfuls 2 in. apart onto ungreased baking sheets.
7. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.
8. Cool on wire racks.

ingredients:
1 cup creamy peanut butter
1/4 cup confectioners' sugar
2 tablespoons butter, softened
1/2 teaspoon salt
2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
2 tablespoons shortening
cooking_instructions:
1. In a small bowl, combine the peanut butter, confectioners' sugar, butter, and salt until smooth.
2. In a microwave, melt chocolate chips and shortening; stir until smooth.
3. Drop a teaspoonful of chocolate mixture into paper-lined miniature muffin cups.
4. Top each with a teaspoonful of peanut butter mixture; top with another teaspoonful of chocolate mixture.
5. Refrigerate until set.

ingredients:
1 pound ground beef
1 medium onion, chopped
1 can (10-3/4 ounces) condensed cream of mushroom soup, undiluted
1 can (14-1/2 ounces) diced tomatoes, undrained
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
2 cups frozen mixed vegetables, thawed
2 cups mashed potatoes (prepared with milk and butter)
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large ovenproof skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
2. Stir in the soup, tomatoes, salt, and pepper.
3. Bring to a boil.
4. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 5 minutes.
5. Stir in vegetables; heat through.
6. Top with mashed potatoes.
7. Broil 4-6 in. from the heat for 3-5 minutes or until potatoes are lightly browned.

ingredients:
1 pound ground beef
1 medium onion, chopped
2 cans (15 ounces each) tomato sauce
1/2 teaspoon garlic powder
1/2 teaspoon dried oregano
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1 package (25 ounces) frozen cheese ravioli
2 cups (8 ounces) shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 400°F (200°C).
2. In a large skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.
3. Stir in the tomato sauce, garlic powder, oregano, salt, and pepper; heat through.
4. Spread 1/2 cup meat sauce into a greased 13x9-in. baking dish.
5. Layer with half of the ravioli, 1-1/4 cups meat sauce, and 1 cup cheese.
6. Repeat layers.
7. Cover and bake for 40-45 minutes or until bubbly and cheese is melted.

ingredients:
2 tablespoons olive oil
1 medium onion, chopped
3 garlic cloves, minced
2 medium carrots, chopped
2 celery ribs, chopped
6 cups chicken broth
1 teaspoon dried thyme
1 teaspoon dried rosemary, crushed
1/2 teaspoon pepper
2 cups uncooked egg noodles
2 cups shredded cooked chicken
cooking_instructions:
1. In a Dutch oven, heat oil over medium heat.
2. Add onion, garlic, carrots, and celery; cook and stir until vegetables are tender.
3. Stir in the broth, thyme, rosemary, and pepper.
4. Bring to a boil.
5. Stir in noodles; cook for 8-10 minutes or until tender.
6. Stir in chicken; heat through before serving.

ingredients:
2 cups crushed pretzels
3/4 cup butter, melted
3 tablespoons sugar
FILLING:
2 cups whipped topping
1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened
1 cup sugar
TOPPING:
2 packages (3 ounces each) strawberry gelatin
2 cups boiling water
1 package (16 ounces) frozen sweetened sliced strawberries, thawed
1 can (20 ounces) crushed pineapple, undrained
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a bowl, combine the pretzels, butter, and sugar. Press into an ungreased 13x9-in. baking dish.
3. Bake for 10 minutes. Cool on a wire rack.
4. For filling, in a small bowl, beat whipped topping and cream cheese until smooth. Spread over pretzel crust. Refrigerate until chilled.
5. For topping, dissolve gelatin in boiling water in a large bowl. Stir in strawberries and pineapple. Refrigerate for 1 hour or until partially set.
6. Carefully spoon over cream cheese layer. Refrigerate until firm.

ingredients:
2 cups uncooked penne pasta
2 cups cubed cooked chicken
1 cup sliced fresh mushrooms
1 cup chopped sweet red pepper
1/2 cup chopped onion
1/2 cup chopped green pepper
1 jar (16 ounces) Alfredo sauce
1 cup shredded part-skim mozzarella cheese
1/2 cup grated Parmesan cheese
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Cook pasta according to package directions; drain.
2. In a large bowl, combine the pasta, chicken, mushrooms, peppers, and onion.
3. Add Alfredo sauce and toss to coat.
4. Transfer to a greased 13x9-in. baking dish.
5. Sprinkle with cheeses.
6. Bake, uncovered, for 25-30 minutes or until bubbly and heated through.

ingredients:
5-1/3 cups sweetened shredded coconut
1 can (14 ounces) sweetened condensed milk
1 teaspoon almond extract
1/2 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
4 large egg whites
1 cup chopped almonds, toasted
1 cup semisweet chocolate chips
1 teaspoon shortening
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 325°F (160°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the coconut, milk, extract, flour, and salt.
3. In a small bowl, beat egg whites until stiff peaks form; fold into coconut mixture.
4. Drop by tablespoonfuls 2 in. apart onto greased baking sheets.
5. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until lightly browned.
6. Remove to wire racks to cool.
7. Dip bottoms of cookies in melted chocolate; allow excess to drip off.
8. Place on waxed paper; let stand until set.

ingredients:
6 large potatoes
1/2 cup sour cream
1/4 cup butter, cubed
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1-1/2 cups (6 ounces) shredded cheddar cheese, divided
3 green onions, chopped and divided
10 bacon strips, cooked and crumbled, divided
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Scrub and pierce potatoes; place on a microwave-safe plate.
3. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 18-22 minutes or until tender, turning once.
4. When cool enough to handle, cut potatoes in half lengthwise.
5. Scoop out the pulp and place in a large bowl; discard shells.
6. Mash the pulp with sour cream, butter, salt, and pepper.
7. Stir in 1 cup cheese, half of the green onions, and half of the bacon.
8. Spoon into a greased 2-1/2-qt. baking dish.
9. Sprinkle with remaining cheese, onions, and bacon.
10. Bake, uncovered, for 30 minutes or until heated through.

ingredients:
1 pound ground beef
1 can (15 ounces) pinto beans, rinsed and drained
1 can (15 ounces) whole kernel corn, drained
1 can (10 ounces) diced tomatoes and green chilies, undrained
1 can (8 ounces) tomato sauce
1 envelope taco seasoning
2-1/2 cups water
Tortilla chips, shredded cheddar cheese, sliced ripe olives, and sour cream, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large saucepan, cook beef over medium heat until no longer pink; drain.
2. Stir in the beans, corn, tomatoes, tomato sauce, taco seasoning, and water.
3. Bring to a boil.
4. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 15 minutes to allow flavors to blend.
5. Garnish with chips, cheese, olives, and sour cream if desired.

ingredients:
1/2 cup uncooked long grain rice
1/2 cup water
1/4 cup chopped onion
1 teaspoon salt, divided
1/8 teaspoon pepper
1 pound ground beef
1 tablespoon canola oil
1 can (15 ounces) tomato sauce
1/2 cup water
1 teaspoon Worcestershire sauce
cooking_instructions:
1. In a small bowl, combine the rice, 1/2 cup water, onion, 1/2 teaspoon salt, and pepper.
2. Crumble beef over mixture and mix well.
3. Shape into 1-1/2-in. balls.
4. In a large skillet, brown meatballs in oil; drain.
5. Combine the tomato sauce, 1/2 cup water, Worcestershire sauce, and remaining salt; pour over meatballs.
6. Bring to a boil.
7. Reduce heat; cover and simmer for 35-40 minutes or until meat is no longer pink and rice is tender.

ingredients:
1/2 cup butter, softened
1 cup sugar
1-1/2 cups all-purpose flour
2 teaspoons baking powder
1/2 teaspoon salt
1 cup 2% milk
2 cups sliced peeled fresh or frozen peaches
TOPPING:
1-1/2 cups sugar
1 tablespoon cornstarch
1 cup boiling water
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar until light and fluffy.
2. Combine the flour, baking powder, and salt; add to creamed mixture alternately with milk, beating well after each addition.
3. Spread into a greased 13x9-in. baking dish.
4. Top with peaches.
5. For topping, combine sugar and cornstarch in a small bowl; gradually whisk in boiling water.
6. Pour over peaches.
7. Bake for 50-55 minutes or until golden brown.

ingredients:
2 cups crushed saltines (about 60 crackers)
1 cup chopped pecans
1 cup packed brown sugar
3/4 cup butter, cubed
2 cups semisweet chocolate chips
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the saltines and pecans.
3. In a large saucepan, combine brown sugar and butter; bring to a boil, stirring constantly.
4. Pour over cracker mixture; toss to coat evenly.
5. Transfer to a greased 15x10x1-in. baking pan.
6. Bake for 10-12 minutes or until bubbly.
7. Sprinkle with chocolate chips.
8. Let stand for 5 minutes; spread melted chocolate over the top.
9. Cool completely on a wire rack before cutting.

ingredients:
12 dinner rolls (about 2 inches in diameter)
12 thin slices deli ham
6 slices Swiss cheese, halved
1/3 cup mayonnaise
1 tablespoon finely chopped onion
1 tablespoon poppy seeds
2 teaspoons Dijon mustard
1/4 cup butter, melted
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. Without separating rolls, cut horizontally in half; arrange bottoms in a greased 13x9-in. baking pan.
3. Layer with ham and cheese.
4. In a small bowl, combine the mayonnaise, onion, poppy seeds, and mustard; spread over tops.
5. Replace tops.
6. Drizzle butter over rolls.
7. Bake, uncovered, for 25-30 minutes or until cheese is melted. Serve warm.

ingredients:
6 bone-in chicken thighs (about 2-1/4 pounds)
1/3 cup reduced-sodium soy sauce
1/4 cup sugar
2 tablespoons cider vinegar
1/4 teaspoon ground ginger
1/4 teaspoon pepper
1/2 teaspoon minced garlic
1-1/2 teaspoons cornstarch
1-1/2 teaspoons cold water
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
2. Arrange chicken in an ungreased 13x9-in. baking dish.
3. In a small saucepan, combine the soy sauce, sugar, vinegar, ginger, pepper, and garlic; bring to a boil.
4. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, for 5 minutes.
5. Pour over chicken.
6. Bake, uncovered, for 45-50 minutes or until chicken juices run clear.
7. Remove chicken to a serving platter and keep warm.
8. Transfer cooking juices to a small saucepan; skim fat.
9. Bring cooking juices to a boil.
10. Combine cornstarch and water until smooth; gradually stir into pan.
11. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
12. Serve with chicken.

ingredients:
1 cup butter, cubed
1 cup creamy peanut butter
1 teaspoon vanilla extract
1 pound confectioners' sugar
cooking_instructions:
1. In a microwave-safe bowl, combine the butter and peanut butter.
2. Microwave, uncovered, on high for 2 minutes or until melted.
3. Stir in vanilla.
4. Gradually stir in confectioners' sugar until smooth.
5. Spread into a greased 8-in. square dish.
6. Refrigerate until set before cutting.

ingredients:
1 package (16 ounces) elbow macaroni
1/2 cup mayonnaise
1/4 cup sweet pickle relish
2 tablespoons cider vinegar
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/4 teaspoon pepper
6 hard-boiled large eggs, chopped
6 cooked bacon strips, crumbled
1 small onion, chopped
1 celery rib, chopped
cooking_instructions:
1. Cook macaroni according to package directions; drain and rinse in cold water.
2. In a large bowl, combine the mayonnaise, relish, vinegar, salt, and pepper.
3. Stir in the macaroni, eggs, bacon, onion, and celery.
4. Cover and refrigerate for at least 2 hours before serving.

ingredients:
1-1/2 cups all-purpose flour
1 cup quick-cooking oats
1/4 cup packed brown sugar
1 tablespoon baking powder
1/2 teaspoon ground cinnamon
1/4 teaspoon salt
1-1/2 cups 2% milk
1/4 cup canola oil
2 large eggs
Additional milk, optional
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large bowl, combine the flour, oats, brown sugar, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt.
2. In another bowl, whisk the milk, oil, and eggs.
3. Stir into dry ingredients just until moistened.
4. Pour batter by 1/4 cupfuls onto a greased hot griddle.
5. Turn when bubbles form on top; cook until the second side is golden brown. If desired, thin pancake batter with additional milk.

ingredients:
1/4 cup lime juice
3 tablespoons honey
1 tablespoon chili powder
1 garlic clove, minced
1 pound boneless skinless chicken breasts
8 taco shells
TOPPINGS:
2 cups shredded lettuce
1 cup chopped tomato
1 cup shredded cheddar cheese
1/2 cup salsa
1/4 cup sour cream
cooking_instructions:
1. In a small bowl, combine the lime juice, honey, chili powder, and garlic.
2. Pour 1/4 cup marinade into a large resealable plastic bag; add the chicken.
3. Seal bag and turn to coat; refrigerate for 1 hour.
4. Cover and refrigerate remaining marinade.
5. Drain and discard marinade.
6. Grill chicken, covered, over medium heat for 6-7 minutes on each side or until juices run clear, basting occasionally with reserved marinade.
7. Cut chicken into thin strips.
8. Spoon chicken into taco shells; top with toppings of your choice.

ingredients:
1/4 cup butter
1/4 cup all-purpose flour
1/4 teaspoon salt
1/8 teaspoon pepper
2 cups chicken broth
1 cup half-and-half cream
1 can (4 ounces) mushroom stems and pieces, undrained
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large saucepan, melt butter.
2. Stir in the flour, salt, and pepper until smooth; gradually add broth and cream.
3. Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.
4. Add mushrooms; heat through.

ingredients:
1 pound ground pork
1 package (16 ounces) coleslaw mix
1 medium onion, chopped
2 garlic cloves, minced
1 tablespoon soy sauce
1 teaspoon ground ginger
1/2 teaspoon salt
1/2 teaspoon pepper
1/4 teaspoon crushed red pepper flakes
4 cups chicken broth
4 ounces uncooked wide rice noodles
cooking_instructions:
1. In a large skillet, cook pork, coleslaw mix, onion, and garlic over medium heat 6-8 minutes or until pork is no longer pink and vegetables are tender, breaking pork into crumbles.
2. Stir in soy sauce, ginger, salt, pepper, and pepper flakes; cook 2 minutes longer.
3. Stir in broth; bring to a boil. Stir in noodles; return to a boil. Reduce heat; simmer, uncovered, 6-8 minutes or until noodles are tender, stirring occasionally.

ingredients:
1 package white cake mix (regular size)
1 package (3 ounces) strawberry gelatin
1/4 cup sugar
1 cup water
1/2 cup unsweetened applesauce
4 large egg whites
1/4 cup canola oil
1/2 cup chopped fresh strawberries
FROSTING:
1 package (8 ounces) cream cheese, softened
1/4 cup butter, softened
4 cups confectioners' sugar
1/2 cup chopped fresh strawberries
cooking_instructions:
1. Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C).
2. In a large bowl, combine the cake mix, gelatin, and sugar. Add water, applesauce, egg whites, and oil; beat on low speed for 30 seconds. Beat on medium for 2 minutes.
3. Fold in strawberries.
4. Pour into three greased and floured 9-in. round baking pans.
5. Bake for 20-25 minutes or until a toothpick inserted in the center comes out clean.
6. Cool for 10 minutes before removing from pans to wire racks to cool completely.
7. For frosting, in a large bowl, beat cream cheese and butter until fluffy. Beat in confectioners' sugar until smooth. Stir in strawberries.
8. Spread frosting between layers and over top and sides of cake.
